Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> made<S>5648</S> an image<S>6755</S> of gold<S>1722</S>, whose height<S>7314</S> was threescore<S>8361</S> cubits<S>521</S>, and the breadth<S>6613</S> thereof six<S>8353</S> cubits<S>521</S>: he set it up<S>6966</S> in the plain<S>1236</S> of Dura<S>1757</S>, in the province<S>4083</S> of Babylon<S>895</S>.
Then Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> sent<S>7972</S> to gather together<S>3673</S> the princes<S>324</S>, the governors<S>5460</S>, and the captains<S>6347</S>, the judges<S>148</S>, the treasurers<S>1411</S>, the counsellors<S>1884</S>, the sheriffs<S>8614</S>, and all<S>3606</S> the rulers<S>7984</S> of the provinces<S>4083</S>, to come<S>858</S> to the dedication<S>2597</S> of the image<S>6755</S> which Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> had set up<S>6966</S>.
Then<S>116</S> the princes<S>324</S>, the governors<S>5460</S>, and captains<S>6347</S>, the judges<S>148</S>, the treasurers<S>1411</S>, the counsellors<S>1884</S>, the sheriffs<S>8614</S>, and all<S>3606</S> the rulers<S>7984</S> of the provinces<S>4083</S>, were gathered together<S>3673</S> unto the dedication<S>2597</S> of the image<S>6755</S> that Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> had set up<S>6966</S>; and they stood<S>6966</S> before<S>6903</S> the image<S>6755</S> that Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> had set up<S>6966</S>.
Then an herald<S>3744</S> cried<S>7123</S> aloud<S>2429</S>, To you it is commanded<S>560</S>, O people<S>5972</S>, nations<S>524</S>, and languages<S>3961</S>, <sup>aloud: Cald. with might</sup> <sup>it: Cald. they command</sup>
That at what time<S>5732</S> ye hear<S>8086</S> the sound<S>7032</S> of the cornet<S>7162</S>, flute<S>4953</S>, harp<S>7030</S> <S>7030</S>, sackbut<S>5443</S>, psaltery<S>6460</S>, dulcimer<S>5481</S>, and all<S>3606</S> kinds<S>2178</S> of musick<S>2170</S>, ye fall down<S>5308</S> and worship<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S> that Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> hath set up<S>6966</S>: <sup>dulcimer: or, singing: Cald. symphony</sup>
And whoso<S>4479</S> falleth<S>5308</S> not<S>3809</S> down<S>5308</S> and worshippeth<S>5457</S> shall the same hour<S>8160</S> be cast<S>7412</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of a burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>.
Therefore<S>6903</S> <S>1836</S> at that time<S>2166</S>, when<S>1768</S> all<S>3606</S> the people<S>5972</S> heard<S>8086</S> the sound<S>7032</S> of the cornet<S>7162</S>, flute<S>4953</S>, harp<S>7030</S> <S>7030</S>, sackbut<S>5443</S>, psaltery<S>6460</S>, and all<S>3606</S> kinds<S>2178</S> of musick<S>2170</S>, all<S>3606</S> the people<S>5972</S>, the nations<S>524</S>, and the languages<S>3961</S>, fell down<S>5308</S> and worshipped<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S> that Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> had set up<S>6966</S>.
Wherefore<S>6903</S> <S>3606</S> at that<S>1836</S> time<S>2166</S> certain<S>1400</S> Chaldeans<S>3779</S> came near<S>7127</S>, and accused<S>7170</S> <S>399</S> the Jews<S>3062</S>.
They spake<S>6032</S> and said<S>560</S> to the king<S>4430</S> Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S>, O king<S>4430</S>, live<S>2418</S> for ever<S>5957</S>.
Thou<S>607</S>, O king<S>4430</S>, hast made<S>7761</S> a decree<S>2942</S>, that every<S>3606</S> man<S>606</S> that shall hear<S>8086</S> the sound<S>7032</S> of the cornet<S>7162</S>, flute<S>4953</S>, harp<S>7030</S> <S>7030</S>, sackbut<S>5443</S>, psaltery<S>6460</S>, and dulcimer<S>5481</S> <S>5481</S>, and all<S>3606</S> kinds<S>2178</S> of musick<S>2170</S>, shall fall down<S>5308</S> and worship<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S>:
And whoso<S>4479</S> falleth<S>5308</S> not<S>3809</S> down<S>5308</S> and worshippeth<S>5457</S>, that he should be cast<S>7412</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of a burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>.
There are<S>383</S> certain<S>1400</S> Jews<S>3062</S> whom<S>3487</S> thou hast set<S>4483</S> over<S>5922</S> the affairs<S>5673</S> of the province<S>4083</S> of Babylon<S>895</S>, Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>; these<S>479</S> men<S>1400</S>, O king<S>4430</S>, have<S>7761</S> not<S>3809</S> regarded<S>2942</S> thee<S>5922</S>: they serve<S>6399</S> not<S>3809</S> thy gods<S>426</S>, nor<S>3809</S> worship<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S> which thou hast set up<S>6966</S>. <sup>have: Cald. have set no regard upon thee</sup>
Then<S>116</S> Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> in his rage<S>7266</S> and fury<S>2528</S> commanded<S>560</S> to bring<S>858</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>. Then<S>116</S> they brought<S>858</S> these<S>479</S> men<S>1400</S> before<S>6925</S> the king<S>4430</S>.
Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> spake<S>6032</S> and said<S>560</S> unto them, Is it true<S>6656</S>, O Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, do not<S>3809</S> ye<S>383</S> serve<S>6399</S> my gods<S>426</S>, nor<S>3809</S> worship<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S> which I have set<S>6966</S> up? <sup>true: or, of purpose</sup>
Now<S>3705</S> if<S>2006</S> ye be<S>383</S> ready<S>6263</S> that at what time<S>5732</S> ye hear<S>8086</S> the sound<S>7032</S> of the cornet<S>7162</S>, flute<S>4953</S>, harp<S>7030</S> <S>7030</S>, sackbut<S>5443</S>, psaltery<S>6460</S>, and dulcimer<S>5481</S>, and all<S>3606</S> kinds<S>2178</S> of musick<S>2170</S>, ye fall down<S>5308</S> and worship<S>5457</S> the image<S>6755</S> which I have made<S>5648</S>; well: but if<S>2006</S> ye worship<S>5457</S> not<S>3809</S>, ye shall be cast<S>7412</S> the same hour<S>8160</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of a burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>; and who<S>4479</S> is that God<S>426</S> that shall deliver<S>7804</S> you out of<S>4481</S> my hands<S>3028</S>?
Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, answered<S>6032</S> and said<S>560</S> to the king<S>4430</S>, O Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S>, we<S>586</S> are not<S>3809</S> careful<S>2818</S> to answer<S>8421</S> thee in<S>5922</S> this<S>1836</S> matter<S>6600</S>.
If<S>2006</S> it be so, our God<S>426</S> whom we<S>586</S> serve<S>6399</S> is<S>383</S> able<S>3202</S> to deliver<S>7804</S> us from<S>4481</S> the burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>, and<S>4481</S> he will deliver<S>7804</S> us out of<S>4481</S> thine hand<S>3028</S>, O king<S>4430</S>.
But if<S>2006</S> not<S>3809</S>, be it<S>1934</S> known<S>3046</S> unto thee, O king<S>4430</S>, that we will<S>383</S> not<S>3809</S> serve<S>6399</S> thy gods<S>426</S>, nor<S>3809</S> worship<S>5457</S> the golden<S>1722</S> image<S>6755</S> which thou hast set up<S>6966</S>.
Then<S>116</S> was Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> full<S>4391</S> of fury<S>2528</S>, and the form<S>6755</S> of his visage<S>600</S> was changed<S>8133</S> against<S>5922</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>: therefore he spake<S>6032</S>, and commanded<S>560</S> that they should heat<S>228</S> the furnace<S>861</S> one<S>2298</S> seven times<S>7655</S> more<S>5922</S> than<S>1768</S> it was wont<S>2370</S> to be heated<S>228</S>. <sup>full: Cald. filled</sup>
And he commanded<S>560</S> the most<S>2429</S> mighty<S>1401</S> men<S>1400</S> that were in his army<S>2429</S> to bind<S>3729</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, and to cast<S>7412</S> them into the burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>. <sup>most: Cald. mighty of strength</sup>
Then<S>116</S> these<S>479</S> men<S>1400</S> were bound<S>3729</S> in their coats<S>5622</S>, their hosen<S>6361</S> <S>6361</S>, and their hats<S>3737</S>, and their other garments<S>3831</S>, and were cast<S>7412</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of the burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>. <sup>coats: or, mantles</sup> <sup>hats: or, turbans</sup>
Therefore<S>3606</S> <S>6903</S> because<S>4481</S> <S>1836</S> the king's<S>4430</S> commandment<S>4406</S> was urgent<S>2685</S>, and the furnace<S>861</S> exceeding<S>3493</S> hot<S>228</S>, the flame<S>7631</S> of the fire<S>5135</S> slew<S>6992</S> those<S>479</S> men<S>1400</S> <S>1994</S> that took up<S>5267</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>. <sup>commandment: Cald. word</sup> <sup>flame: or, spark</sup>
And these<S>479</S> three<S>8532</S> men<S>1400</S>, Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, fell down<S>5308</S> bound<S>3729</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of the burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>.
Then<S>116</S> Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> the king<S>4430</S> was astonied<S>8429</S>, and rose up<S>6966</S> in haste<S>927</S>, and spake<S>6032</S>, and said<S>560</S> unto his counsellors<S>1907</S>, Did not<S>3809</S> we cast<S>7412</S> three<S>8532</S> men<S>1400</S> bound<S>3729</S> into the midst<S>1459</S> of the fire<S>5135</S>? They answered<S>6032</S> and said<S>560</S> unto the king<S>4430</S>, True<S>3330</S>, O king<S>4430</S>. <sup>counsellors: or, governors</sup>
He answered<S>6032</S> and said<S>560</S>, Lo<S>1888</S>, I<S>576</S> see<S>2370</S> four<S>703</S> men<S>1400</S> loose<S>8271</S>, walking<S>1981</S> in the midst<S>1459</S> of the fire<S>5135</S>, and they have<S>383</S> no<S>3809</S> hurt<S>2257</S>; and the form<S>7299</S> of the fourth<S>7244</S> is like<S>1821</S> the Son<S>1247</S> of God<S>426</S>. <sup>they: Cald. there is no hurt in them</sup>
Then<S>116</S> Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> came near<S>7127</S> to the mouth<S>8651</S> of the burning<S>3345</S> fiery<S>5135</S> furnace<S>861</S>, and spake<S>6032</S>, and said<S>560</S>, Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, ye servants<S>5649</S> of the most high<S>5943</S> God<S>426</S>, come forth<S>5312</S>, and come<S>858</S> hither. Then<S>116</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, came forth<S>5312</S> of<S>4481</S> the midst<S>1459</S> of the fire<S>5135</S>. <sup>mouth: Cald. door</sup>
And the princes<S>324</S>, governors<S>5460</S>, and captains<S>6347</S>, and the king's<S>4430</S> counsellors<S>1907</S>, being gathered together<S>3673</S>, saw<S>2370</S> these<S>479</S> men<S>1400</S>, upon whose bodies<S>1655</S> the fire<S>5135</S> had no<S>3809</S> power<S>7981</S>, nor<S>3809</S> was an hair<S>8177</S> of their head<S>7217</S> singed<S>2761</S>, neither<S>3809</S> were their coats<S>5622</S> changed<S>8133</S>, nor<S>3809</S> the smell<S>7382</S> of fire<S>5135</S> had passed<S>5709</S> on them.
Then Nebuchadnezzar<S>5020</S> spake<S>6032</S>, and said<S>560</S>, Blessed<S>1289</S> be the God<S>426</S> of Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, who hath sent<S>7972</S> his angel<S>4398</S>, and delivered<S>7804</S> his servants<S>5649</S> that trusted<S>7365</S> in him<S>5922</S>, and have changed<S>8133</S> the king's<S>4430</S> word<S>4406</S>, and yielded<S>3052</S> their bodies<S>1655</S>, that they might not<S>3809</S> serve<S>6399</S> nor<S>3809</S> worship<S>5457</S> any<S>3606</S> god<S>426</S>, except<S>3861</S> their own God<S>426</S>.
Therefore I<S>4481</S> make<S>7761</S> a decree<S>2942</S>, That every<S>3606</S> people<S>5972</S>, nation<S>524</S>, and language<S>3961</S>, which speak<S>560</S> any thing amiss<S>7960</S> <S>7955</S> against<S>5922</S> the God<S>426</S> of Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, shall be cut<S>5648</S> in pieces<S>1917</S>, and their houses<S>1005</S> shall be made<S>7739</S> a dunghill<S>5122</S>: because<S>6903</S> <S>3606</S> there is<S>383</S> no<S>3809</S> other<S>321</S> God<S>426</S> that can<S>3202</S> deliver<S>5338</S> after this<S>1836</S> sort. <sup>I make: Cald. a decree is made by me</sup> <sup>any: Cald. error</sup> <sup>cut: Cald. made pieces</sup>
Then<S>116</S> the king<S>4430</S> promoted<S>6744</S> Shadrach<S>7715</S>, Meshach<S>4336</S>, and Abednego<S>5665</S>, in the province<S>4083</S> of Babylon<S>895</S>. <sup>promoted: Cald. made to prosper</sup>
